info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 12:00PM CDT until April 24 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Brown and Coleman.
* WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from Brownwood to Indian Creek and Brookesmith moving east at 35 mph. A quick inch of rain is likely over Brownwood. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownwood, Coleman, Early, Santa Anna, Bangs, Blanket, Lake Brownwood, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Grosvenor, Lake Brownwood State Park, Byrds, Camp Bowie, Trickham, Brookesmith, Zephyr, Thrifty, Owens, Echo, Indian Creek and Fisk. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Gifford at Beaver, Austin Street at Avenue G, Belle Plain at Romines, Good Shephard at 11th, Magnolia at Belmeade, Indian Creek at 9th, Willis at Belmeade, 4th Street at Wood, Cordell at Anderson and Austin Street at Avenue J. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
